sections.heading: UB COMPLAINT KYC PROCESS
content: The following steps outline the detailed flow of the process, from initiation to approval. Each step has been structured to ensure clarity, precision, and a smooth user experience.

subsections.heading: INITIATOR PROCESS
content: Login: The UBL team logs in to the Manch application using the provided credentials.
File Upload:
The UBL team uploads a bulk file containing all necessary details such as outlet codes, contact information, and any other required data.
The system validates the uploaded file for completeness.
Below are the data point mentioned for the file upload format -

subsections.heading: SPOC BEHAVIOR
content: SMS Notification: An SMS containing a link is sent to the SPOC’s mobile number.
SMS Reminder: Manch will share the SMS containing a link again to SPOC mobile number on twice a Weekly basis till the KYC is submitted by SPOC.
OTP Authentication:
The SPOC opens the link and receives an OTP (One-Time Password) for additional authentication.
The SPOC enters the OTP, and after successful verification, the Manch platform opens the link.
Outlet Code Entry:  The SPOC enters the Outlet Code, which is validated by the Manch system against the code associated with the generated link.
Agreement to Policies:
Upon accessing the link, the SPOC is prompted to agree to the data privacy policy and terms of conditions.
Note:  We will use the same TOS used in the Outlet KYC. If there is any changes, please update the same.
Form Opening: Manch will open the form and SPOC needs to enter the required details as mentioned below
Note: Details will change based on the answer given by SPOC and validated by MANCH with the system data.
Below table represent the dropdown values of questionnaires asked in SPOC screen.

subsections.heading: APPROVER PROCESS
content: Assignment to Approver: Once all the mandatory fields are entered, validated, and the request is submitted, the system automatically assigns the request to the appropriate approver.
Individual Approval:
The approval flow for individuals will only be routed to the TSE approvers in two specific cases, followed by the UB team as mentioned below.
In all other scenarios, it directly goes to the UB team.
Establishment Approval : All requests will it directly goes to the UB team.
Note – The assignment is based on outlet code mapping to ensure the request reaches the correct approver for review.
Approver access: Approvers have two methods to access the transaction, review and act on requests as mentioned below -
Email Notification:
The Manch system sends an email notification to the approver with a link to review the request.
The approver clicks the link to access all request details and can either approve or reject the request based on the provided information.
Manch System Login:
The approver can log in to the Manch system, navigate to the "Pending Requests" section, and review the details.
After reviewing, the approver can either approve or reject the request.
TSE View and Action
Log into the Manch system: TSE logs into the Manch system and views all pending requests.
Open the transaction: TSE opens a transaction to see the details uploaded in the bulk file, and details entered by the SPOC, along with the relevant documents.
Approve or Reject the request:
If TSE clicks "Approve," they enter an approval comment and submit it. The request then moves to the next level of approver.
If TSE clicks "Reject," they select a rejection reason from a dropdown (configured based on UB rejection reasons) and submit it. The request returns to the SPOC for necessary modifications.
Resubmit by SPOC : Once the SPOC submits the required details, the request assigns back to TSE, who can then repeat the approval or rejection
UB approver View and Action
Log into the Manch system: UB approver logs into the Manch system and views all pending requests.
Open the transaction:
UB approver opens a transaction to see the details uploaded in the bulk file, and details entered by the SPOC, along with the relevant documents.
Respond to mandatory question:
Individual Use case :
UB approver answers the mandatory question: "Are you approving this request?" by selecting either "Yes" or "No" from the dropdown menu.
Approve or reject the request:
If UB approver clicks "Approve," they enter an approval comment and submit it. The request then moves to Accepted status.
If UB approver clicks "Reject," they select a rejection reason from a dropdown (configured based on UB rejection reasons) and submit it. The request returns to the SPOC for necessary modifications.
Resubmit by SPOC :

Once the SPOC submits the required details, the request assigns back to TSE(In case of individual use cases) or ASM (In case of group use cases) who can then repeat the approval or rejection process as outlined above

sections.heading: REPORTS
content: One report will be generated by Manch for this process combining the individual transactions of Outlet KYC Process.

sections.heading: DEPENDENCY
content: SMS / Email Template if there are any changes to the existing format

headers: Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment?

These are the series of questions / drop: Licensee is an individual Are you an individual or an establishment? - Individual Are you the licensee? - Yes Who is the beneficiary? - Individual
Licensee is an individual Are you an Individual or an establishment? - Individual Are you the licensee? - Yes Who is the beneficiary? - Other Beneficiary
Licensee is an individual Are you an individual or an establishment? - Individual Are you the licensee? - No Who is the beneficiary? - Other Beneficiary
4. Licensee is an establishment Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? Establishment Is the beneficiary the establishment or the proprietor? - Establishment
5. Licensee is an establishment Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? Establishment Is the beneficiary the establishment or the proprietor? - Proprietor
6. Licensee is an establishment Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? Establishment Is the beneficiary the establishment or the proprietor? - Other Beneficiary
